name: Joseph Byrd
description: '''Joseph Hunter Byrd Jr.''' (born December 19, 1937) is an American composer, musician and academic. After first becoming known as an [[experimental music|experimental]] composer in [[New York City]] and [[Los Angeles]] in the early and mid-1960s, he became the leader of [[The United States of America (band)|The United States of America]], an innovative but short-lived [[Musical ensemble|band]] that integrated [[electronic music|electronic sound]] and radical political ideas into [[rock music]]. In 1968 he recorded the album ''[[The American Metaphysical Circus]]'', credited to '''Joe Byrd and the Field Hippies'''. After working as a [[record producer]], [[arrangement|arranger]], and [[soundtrack]] composer, he became a university teacher in music history and theory.
